result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Reistad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Heroin) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done. Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge out of up to 25% prison funds, and any balance as a condition of ES in his other prison case(s), or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

To be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher L Reistad

records.addlTxt:
DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher L Reistad in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Christopher L Reistad in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served, to be served in Wisconsin State Prison system. 

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge out of up to 25% prison funds, and any balance as a condition of ES in his other prison case(s), or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Christopher L Reistad in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-20-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher L Reistad in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-02-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher L Reistad in court with attorney Richard Johnson for Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Christopher L Reistad in custody.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher L Reistad in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Christopher L Reistad in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
